intro: Eriocaulon tenuifolium, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, white bloom, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowering spikes are usually slender and may produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Eriocaulon tenuifolium plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
